releaseNotes.releaseNotesTooltip:
What's new in JetPack 6.2:
  • Support for new reference boost power modes for Jetson Orin Nano and Jetson Orin NX modules
  • Jetson Orin Nano now supports additional 25W and MAXN SUPER (uncapped) reference power modes
  • Jetson Orin NX now supports additional 40W and MAXN SUPER (uncapped) reference power modules
  • CVE and minor bug fixes
Open Release Notes

groups.name: CUDA
groups.description: The CUDA Toolkit provides a comprehensive development environment for C and C++ developers building GPU-accelerated applications.

groups.name: NvSci
groups.description: NvStreams is a streaming technology which provides a way for libraries understanding high dimensional data (CUDA, VPI etc) to interop with each other.

groups.name: Computer Vision
groups.description: Libraries for Computer Vision and Image Processing.

groups.name: Developer Tools
groups.description: The NVIDIA Developer Tools are a collection of applications, which allow developers to build, debug, profile, and optimize class-leading and cutting-edge software.

groups.name: Jetson Linux image
groups.description: Bootloader and root filesystem with kernel and NVIDIA drivers.

groups.name: Additional Setups
groups.description: Some necessary additional setups need to be done before target components install.

groups.name: CUDA Runtime
groups.description: The CUDA Toolkit provides a comprehensive development environment for C and C++ developers building GPU-accelerated applications.

groups.name: CUDA X-AI Runtime
groups.description: With TensorRT, you can deliver fast inference using INT8 or FP16 optimized precision that significantly reduces latency. The NVIDIA CUDA Deep Neural Network (cuDNN) library provides high-performance GPU acceleration for your application.

groups.name: Computer Vision Runtime
groups.description: Libraries for Computer Vision and Image Processing.

groups.name: NVIDIA Container Runtime
groups.description: NVIDIA Container Runtime with Docker integration. Build and run GPU accelerated containers with Docker

groups.name: Multimedia
groups.description: The Jetson Multimedia API package is a collection of lower-level APIs that support flexible application development.  The GStreamer framework is also included, providing high-level APIs.

groups.name: CUDA
groups.description: The CUDA Toolkit provides a comprehensive development environment for C and C++ developers building GPU-accelerated applications.

groups.name: CUDA-X AI
groups.description: With TensorRT, you can deliver fast inference using INT8 or FP16 optimized precision that significantly reduces latency. The NVIDIA CUDA Deep Neural Network (cuDNN) library provides high-performance GPU acceleration for your application.

groups.name: Computer Vision
groups.description: Libraries for Computer Vision and Image Processing.

groups.name: Developer Tools
groups.description: The NVIDIA target side Developer Tools are a collection of applications, which allow developers to build, debug, profile, and optimize class-leading and cutting-edge software directly on the target.

groups.name: Jetson Platform Services
groups.description: Collection of ready to use services to accelerate AI application development on Jetson Orin Platforms. These services include various AI perception services, sensor management and storage services, analytics services, and other foundational services such as security and networking.

commands: sudo apt-key del $(apt-key list | grep cudatools -B 1| grep 'pub' | cut -d ' ' -f 4 | cut -d/ -f 2)
safe_apt_install "sudo apt-get purge -y $(dpkg -l | grep 'cuda-toolkit-' | grep 12.6 | awk '{print $2}')" 5
sudo apt-key del $(apt-key list | grep cudatools -B 1| grep 'pub' | cut -d ' ' -f 4 | cut -d/ -f 2)
safe_apt_install "sudo apt-get purge -y $(dpkg -l | grep 'cuda-toolkit-' | grep 12.6 | awk '{print $2}')" 5

NV_CUDA_CROSS_HOST_COMP.name: CUDA Cross Compile Package on Host

commands: if command -v docker >/dev/null 2>&1 && systemctl list-unit-files | grep -q '^docker.service'; then
# Add the repository to Apt sources:
safe_apt_install "sudo apt-get install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin" 5
echo Docker service is now installed
echo the Docker group already exists
echo 'Copy IMX219 and IMX477 dtbo to rootfs.'
sed -i '/# parse out target_board for initrd flash/i\    sleep 15' nvsdkmanager_flash.sh
echo sleep 15 seconds to make sure Jetson board is connected back after bootrom check.
echo /etc/exports already contains the image path
echo adding the image path to /etc/exports...
echo sleep 15 seconds to make sure Jetson board is connected back after bootrom check.
safe_apt_install "sudo apt-get install -y gnupg libgomp1 libfreeimage-dev libopenmpi-dev openmpi-bin" 5

NV_L4T_DOCKER_TARGET_POST_INSTALL_COMP.name: NVIDIA Container Runtime with Docker integration (Beta)

commands: echo 'for pkg in docker.io docker-doc docker-compose docker-compose-v2 podman-docker containerd runc; do sudo apt-get remove -qq -y $pkg || true; done'
for pkg in docker.io docker-doc docker-compose docker-compose-v2 podman-docker containerd runc; do sudo apt-get remove -qq -y $pkg || true; done
echo 'for pkg in docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin docker-ce-rootless-extras; do sudo apt-get remove -qq -y $pkg || true; done'
for pkg in docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin docker-ce-rootless-extras; do sudo apt-get remove -qq -y $pkg || true; done
# Add the repository to Apt sources:
safe_apt_install "sudo apt-get install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io docker-buildx-plugin docker-compose-plugin" 5
safe_apt_install "sudo apt-get install -y gnupg libgomp1 libfreeimage-dev libopenmpi-dev openmpi-bin" 5
safe_apt_install "sudo apt-get install -y curl parted cryptsetup jq quota quotatool lsscsi nvme-cli lvm2 network-manager isc-dhcp-server ufw e2fsprogs logrotate python3-pip " 5
